name: Acute Sinusitis with Secondary Infection
chief_complaint: Severe facial pressure and thick yellow nasal discharge for 2 weeks, not improving with over-the-counter medications
physical_findings: tenderness over maxillary and frontal sinuses
post-nasal drip visible on throat examination
prognosis: Good recovery expected within 14 days with appropriate antibiotic therapy and supportive care
description: Bacterial sinusitis developing after initial viral upper respiratory infection, characterized by persistent symptoms beyond 10 days and worsening after initial improvement
